snippet: Small and midsize airports across the country are offering incentives to attract carriers and add routes, but they are in most cases “chasing ghosts,” according to airline industry observers.
abstract: Joe Sharkey On the Road column says that small and midsize airports across the country are offering incentives to attract carriers and add routes, but losses are unlikely to be reversed in most cases.
lead_paragraph: Small and midsize airports across the country are offering incentives to attract carriers and add routes, but they are in most cases “chasing ghosts,” according to airline industry observers.

headline.print_headline: Losses at Smaller Airports Are Unlikely to Be Reversed
headline.main: Losses at Smaller Airports Are Unlikely to Be Reversed
